subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: what you hear is what you get
author: SnowfireL@aol.com
full_text:
-------------------------------1242424082
Content-Type: text/plain; charset="US-ASCII"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 7bit

Well, in that last 5.5 minute tape I made, i asked What's this animal  
called, they someone answered, then I asked what color is my shirt, they  
answered, they are very strong today
 
 
In a message dated 5/15/2009 5:41:03 P.M. Eastern Daylight Time,  
Threadsintyme@... writes:

 
 


It might just make a difference if we knew what shape dem ears of yurns'  
are! LOL
Al
---------- Original Message ----------
From: "April  Abercrombie" <april@abercrombieghapril@abercrapr>
To:  <EVP-ITC@yahoogroupsEVP->
Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: what you  hear is what you get
Date: Fri, 15 May 2009 14:20:30 -0600


LOL!
 

----- Original Message ----- 
From: _Frank Sumption_ (mailto:purplealiengirl@...)  
To: _EVP-ITC@yahoogroupsEVP-_ (mailto:EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com)  
Sent: Friday, May 15, 2009 2:14  PM
Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: what you  hear is what you get



I always listen to EVP wiht my ears!--I know--alien humor.

On Fri, May 15, 2009 at 1:24 PM, April Abercrombie  
<_april@abercrombieghapril@abercrapr_ (mailto:april@...) >  wrote:


 
 


I always listen to EVP's with high  quality headphones.
 
In the "tomorrow let you know"  EVP, I do hear something...know" can't be 
sure that it is a  voice. I does have a cadence similar to someone speaking, 
but it  could just as easily be something present in the environment-it  
could just as easily be something present in the environment-<WBR>a  na it is 
just too feint. I can't make out any clear words. Sure-I  could probably 
matrix some in, but that is all it would be.
 
For an EVP to be considered proof  positive of spirit communication by the 
community at large, it has to be  clear enough that many people hear the 
same thing, without hints or  coaxing. If you have to have high quality devices 
to make it  out, it just isn't good enough. That does not mean it isn't a 
true EVP,  just that it isn't good enough to stand as evidence.
 
As for the whistle, it sounded like  feedback to me as well, but I will 
have to take you word for it that you  were no where near any other electronics 
or EMF's that could contribute to  feedback. Even so, if I am trying to 
remain unbiased and  objective, there is no way for me to say this is a spirit, 
without  personally being with you when you caught it. The only thing I can 
still  say about it is could be, but for me it is non conclusive.
 
If someone does not hear what you are  hearing, try to remain objective and 
just understand that it isn't  personal. You have to understand that with 
just these recordings alone,  there is no way to scientifically prove what 
you have recorded is  spirit communication. If you could get consistent, 
intelligent  question and answer recordings, then you would be alot  closer.
 
Here again, we are back to the "So  what?" thing. You don't HAVE to prove 
anything scientifically, unless you  want others to completely believe in 
your evidence.
 
The theory that is being kicked around  is that some EVP's are personal, 
and only meant for the person  recording them to hear. If this is the case, no 
matter how clear  something is to you, others may not hear it.
 
April
 
 

 
----- Original Message ----- 
From: _James W. Hyslope_ (mailto:clockdryve@...)  
To: _EVP-ITC@yahoogroupsEVP-_ (mailto:EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com)  

 

 
Sent: Friday, May 15, 2009 12:02  PM
Subject: [EVP-ITC] Re: what you  hear is what you get



Okay, I can respect that. If you can't hear them then it must be  either 
mechanical (sound card or headphones)or maybe your hearing has  loss in those 
frequencies.Okay, I can respect that. If you can't hear them then it must be 
 either mechanical (sound card or headpho&  your headphones. I have let an 
older man listen (in his late 60's) and  he has heard most all of the audio. 
Same with a few guys at work. Some  hear them right away, and others can't 
until I loop the actually EVP for  a few tries. I personally use a Dell 
Latitude D430 to hear these. I can  hear some on my cell phone. Headphones are a 
must....or you won't hear  anything either way. *But some can be heard on 
cell phone without  headphones. The conversion to MP3 has also caused some 
loss, but I am  still able to hear them when I review from this site (but I 
have the  repetive hearing syndrome in this area no doubt). Although I do have 
 some disbelief (shock) that a few of these are not discernable. Go back  
and listen to "tomorrow let you know" is in a gruffy-robotic melodic  tone at 
the very end but with higher natural volume. And if you couldn't  hear the 
whistle...I would suggest the need to remove the cotton from  the ear :) As 
for feedback....      repetive hearing syndrome in this area no doubt). 
Although I do have  some disbelief (shock) that a few of these are not 
discernable. Go back  and listen to "tomorrow let you know" is in a gruffy-robotic 
melodic  tone at the very end but with higher natural volume. And if you 
couldn't  hear the whistle...I would suggest the need to remove the cotton from  
the ear :) As for feedback....<WBR>.feedb_EVP-ITC@yahoogroupsEVP-_ 
(mailto:EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com) , "April Abercrombie"  <april@...> wrote:
>
> Here's the thing though - if  you put something out there, and ask people 
to listen to it, your  inviting opinions. Some will be in agreement, and 
some won't, no matter  what.
> 
> If EVP messages are for the one that recorded  them, then it shouldn't 
surprise you , or offend you, if someone doesn't  hear the same thing you do. 
If you don't want contrary opinions on  something, then you should not give 
people the chance to  critique.
> 
> Now I could see if someone flat out said your  recordings were all trash, 
period. You would have every right to be  angry, but no one is saying that, 
at least I am not saying that.
>  
> I just stated that I did not hear what James heard, and though  I wasn't 
going to say he doesn't have anything, I can't say that he does  either.
> 
> ----- Original Message ----- 
> From:  Frank Sumption 
> To: _EVP-ITC@yahoogroupsEVP-_ (mailto:EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com)  
> Sent: Friday,  May 15, 2009 11:00 AM
> Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: what you hear  is what you get
> 
> 
> 
> 
> 
>  
> Yeah, and we've all heard the thing about opinions.
>  
> F-s
> 
> 
> On Fri, May 15, 2009 at 10:53 AM,  April Abercrombie <april@...> wrote:
> 
> 
>  
> 
> 
> Noone is saying what they hear is law, just  their opinion.
> 
> ----- Original Message ----- 
>  From: Frank Sumption 
> To: _EVP-ITC@yahoogroupsEVP-_ (mailto:EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com)  
> Sent: Friday,  May 15, 2009 10:43 AM
> Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: what you hear  is what you get
> 
> 
> 
> Soooo, everyone hears  different, and personally I find it offensive when 
someone presumes to  tell everyone what another researhcer's voices really 
say. I think EVP  messages are for the one that recorded thmm, to everyone 
else it's  non-sense, except there's enough to show that there is a 
phenomenon.  
> 
> I get really tired of these self proclaimed experts  trying to dicate 
what's acceptable.
> 
> Frank-S
>  
> 
> On Fri, May 15, 2009 at 10:04 AM, Rick  <rasterer@...> wrote:
> 
> 
> 
> 
>  I opened your folder and examined all your files.
> 
> Here  are my opinions (I have truncated the file names due to  laziness):
> 
> ahh_mmm noises, no speech
> call_us  noises, no speech
> cal_us (enhanced) several listenings:  pixelated, no speech
> compare_panasonic noises, no speech
>  compare_sony noises, no speech
> first_epv noises, no  speech
> good_whistle noises, no speech (maybe feedback)
>  hey_can noises, no speech
> hey_whats noises, no speech
>  I_hit noises, no speech
> important_date noises, no speech
>  keep_moving several listenings: Hellalal see woobeh 
> laugh_evp  noises, no speech
> lets_wait several listenings: noises, no  speech
> maybe_gun noises, no speech
> miss_you noises, no  speech
> my_question several listenings: no da lee
> oh_  noises, no speech
> something several listenings: noises, no  speech
> that_mans noises, no speech
> that's_jim noises, no  speech
> this_one several listenings: noises, no speech
>  tomorrow noises, no speech
> 
> The ones that took several  listenings I thought I might hear words in, 
so I examined those several  times. Sometimes I could sort of hear something 
that sort of sounded  like what you suggested, but I could also hear it in 
other ways, or not  at all.
> 
> So my suggestion to you, if you want to get  less subjective conjuctures 
or simply less affirmations of your own  interpretations, is to post the 
future ones without labels. The labels  you give can influence the listeners: 
when you have a sound that could  be several things, and you note that it 
sounded like "keep it moving",  the listener can find it nearly impossible to 
try NOT to hear what you  heard, and so not be able to give a fresh 
perspecive to help your  research methods. 
> 
> 
> 
> --- In _EVP-ITC@yahoogroupsEVP-_ (mailto:EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com) , 
"James W. Hyslope"  <clockdryve@> wrote:
> >
> > Go to my Folder in  the files section "Jim's RR-DR60 EVP's" and see if 
anyone (needs to)  decide "FOR ME" and let me know if I am of the serious 
type. In my short  time I have gathered enough "proof" for myself that this 
method works  for ME. And from what I have seen from others that I have let 
"listen"  to my files (friends) I am blessed with the "ability" to HEAR very 
low  audio artifacts... Go to my Folder in  the files section "Jim's RR-DR60 
EVP's" and see if anyone (needs to)  decide "FOR ME" and let me know if I am 
of the serious type. In my short  time I have gathered enough "proof" for 
myself that this m Go to my Folder in  the files section "Jim's RR-DR60 
EVP's" and see if anyone (needs to)  decide "FOR ME" and let me know if I am of 
the serious type. In my short  time I have gathered enough "proof" for myself 
that this method works  for ME. And from what I have seen from others that 
I have let "listen"  to my files (friends) I am blessed with the "ability" 
to HEAR very low  audio artifacts...<WBR>.so this will help me in my 
RESEARCH. And I am  OPEN to any help to reach my goals (or help others) with their 
goals.  Have fun people. On a HAPPIER NOTE :) I was lucky enough to catch the 
 RR-DR60 taking a nap yesterday...<WBR>.it missed a few evp's real close  
together (in a 5 second clip) the Sony ICD-B7 heard a male use a  different 
number than what I used. I said 16 (my earlier age I was  saying in recorder) 
and the male evp said 13....then a female laughs.  All this was missed by 
the DR60 (except my 16 was recorded in both  recorders)  Go to my Folder in  
the files section "Jim's RR-DR60 EVP's" andic" microphone also (something to 
do with those low "booms" that  I have noticed lead or follow many evp's). 
So I look forward to any  ideas. Falure is NOT an option. Haha.....
>  >
>
